intro: Pachira coriacea, commonly known as the African money plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor conditions. Pachira coriacea is also known for its resilience and adaptability to different light and moisture levels.
